intro: Mariscus varicus, commonly known as the variable marshwort, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to wetland and marsh environments in North America. It typically grows to a height of 10–30 centimeters and features basal leaves that are linear to lanceolate in shape. The plant produces small, white to pale pink flowers in clusters during the summer months. Its roots are fibrous and adapted to thrive in waterlogged soils. Mariscus varicus plays a role in stabilizing wetland soils and providing habitat for various invertebrates.
